title: Provides for the submission to the people the question of whether or not to convene a constitutional convention
summary: Provides for the submission to the people the question of whether or not to convene a constitutional convention for the sole and limited purposes of choosing a lieutenant governor in the event of a vacancy in office and for achieving real property tax law reform.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2680

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to provide for the submission to the people of a proposition or question
to convene a constitutional convention

PURPOSE:
To provide for a constitutional convention to be called for the
limited purpose of providing for a process of choosing a lieutenant
governor in the event of a vacancy in such office and for real
property tax reform.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Section 1 provides for the question to be put to the people.
Section 2 provides that if the question is answered in the affirmative
that to provisions of section 2 of Article XIX of the constitution
shall apply and be implemented.
Section 3 provides for the effective date.

JUSTIFICATION:
On two occasions within the last 25 years and 15 times over the
history of the State, the State of New York has not had a lieutenant
governor. The office remains vacant until the next gubernatorial
election. The office of lieutenant governor has many functions
including being first in the gubernatorial succession and president
of the Senate.

The Governor, on July 8,2009, had attempted to appoint a Lieutenant
Governor relying upon the Public Officers Law. This issue should be
taken up before a constitutional convention where the matter can be
debated and given consideration which then can be presented to the
people on the ballot.

LEGISLATIVE HISTORY:
2010: S.6088

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
Immediately, with provisions.
